str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
From the same as aiteo; a cause, i.e. reason, crime.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.
Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
A deposit, anything committed to one's charge or trust. From paratithemi; a deposit, i.e. trust.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
